intro: Clinostigma harlandii, commonly known as the Harland's clinostigma, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with lance-shaped leaves and showy bracteate inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively rare in cultivation.
